trans-unit.source: Tame explosive growth with elastic databases
trans-unit.target: Tame explosive growth with elastic databases

trans-unit.source: An Azure SQL Database elastic database pool is a collection of available resources that are shared by a group of elastic databases.
trans-unit.target: An Azure SQL Database elastic database pool is a collection of available resources that are shared by a group of elastic databases.

trans-unit.source: Tame explosive growth with elastic databases
trans-unit.target: Tame explosive growth with elastic databases

trans-unit.source: If you’re a SaaS developer with tens, hundreds, or even thousands of databases, an elastic database pool simplifies the process of creating, maintaining, and managing performance across these databases within a budget that you control.
trans-unit.target: If you’re a SaaS developer with tens, hundreds, or even thousands of databases, an elastic database pool simplifies the process of creating, maintaining, and managing performance across these databases within a budget that you control.

trans-unit.source: A common SaaS application pattern is for each database to have a different customer, each with varying and unpredictable resource consumption (CPU/IO/Memory summarized with DTU).
trans-unit.target: A common SaaS application pattern is for each database to have a different customer, each with varying and unpredictable resource consumption (CPU/IO/Memory summarized with DTU).

trans-unit.source: With these peaks and valleys of demand for each database, it can be difficult to predict and therefore provision resources.
trans-unit.target: With these peaks and valleys of demand for each database, it can be difficult to predict and therefore provision resources.

trans-unit.source: You're faced with two options; either over-provision database resources based on peak usage--and overpay.
trans-unit.target: You're faced with two options; either over-provision database resources based on peak usage--and overpay.

trans-unit.source: Or under-provision to save cost--at the expense of performance and customer satisfaction during peaks.
trans-unit.target: Or under-provision to save cost--at the expense of performance and customer satisfaction during peaks.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft created elastic database pools specifically to help you solve this problem.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft created elastic database pools specifically to help you solve this problem.

trans-unit.source: Elastic database pools provide a solution for customers who need to ensure that their databases get the performance resources they need, when they need it, while also providing a simple resource allocation mechanism and a predictable budget.
trans-unit.target: Elastic database pools provide a solution for customers who need to ensure that their databases get the performance resources they need, when they need it, while also providing a simple resource allocation mechanism and a predictable budget.

trans-unit.source: The on-demand performance scaling of individual databases within an elastic database pool is possible because each database within a pool uses eDTUs from a shared set associated with the pool.
trans-unit.target: The on-demand performance scaling of individual databases within an elastic database pool is possible because each database within a pool uses eDTUs from a shared set associated with the pool.

trans-unit.source: This allows databases under heavy load to consume more to meet demand, while databases under light load consume less, and databases under no load don’t consume any eDTUs.
trans-unit.target: This allows databases under heavy load to consume more to meet demand, while databases under light load consume less, and databases under no load don’t consume any eDTUs.

trans-unit.source: By provisioning resources for the pool rather than for single databases you not only simplify the management of multiple databases, you also have a predictable budget for an otherwise unpredictable workload.
trans-unit.target: By provisioning resources for the pool rather than for single databases you not only simplify the management of multiple databases, you also have a predictable budget for an otherwise unpredictable workload.

trans-unit.source: If more eDTUs are needed to accommodate the needs of a pool (additional databases are added to a pool or the existing databases start using more eDTUs), additional eDTUs can be added to an existing pool with no database downtime or negative impact on the databases.
trans-unit.target: If more eDTUs are needed to accommodate the needs of a pool (additional databases are added to a pool or the existing databases start using more eDTUs), additional eDTUs can be added to an existing pool with no database downtime or negative impact on the databases.

trans-unit.source: Similarly, if extra eDTUs are no longer needed they can be removed from an existing pool at any point in time.
trans-unit.target: Similarly, if extra eDTUs are no longer needed they can be removed from an existing pool at any point in time.

trans-unit.source: Databases that are great candidates for elastic database pools typically have periods of activity and other periods of inactivity.
trans-unit.target: Databases that are great candidates for elastic database pools typically have periods of activity and other periods of inactivity.

trans-unit.source: Consider the example above where you can see the activity of a single database, 4 databases and finally an elastic database pool with 20 databases.
trans-unit.target: Consider the example above where you can see the activity of a single database, 4 databases and finally an elastic database pool with 20 databases.

trans-unit.source: These databases with varying activity over time are great candidates for elastic database pools because they are not all active at the same time and can share eDTUs.
trans-unit.target: These databases with varying activity over time are great candidates for elastic database pools because they are not all active at the same time and can share eDTUs.

trans-unit.source: Not all databases fit this pattern.
trans-unit.target: Not all databases fit this pattern.

trans-unit.source: There are databases that have a more constant resource demand and these databases are better suited to the Basic, Standard, and Premium service tiers where resources are individually assigned.
trans-unit.target: There are databases that have a more constant resource demand and these databases are better suited to the Basic, Standard, and Premium service tiers where resources are individually assigned.

trans-unit.source: For assistance in determining if your databases would benefit in an elastic database pool, see [Price and performance considerations for an elastic database pool](sql-database-elastic-pool-guidance.md).
trans-unit.target: For assistance in determining if your databases would benefit in an elastic database pool, see [Price and performance considerations for an elastic database pool](sql-database-elastic-pool-guidance.md).

trans-unit.source: You can create an elastic database pool in minutes using the Microsoft Azure portal, PowerShell, or C#.
trans-unit.target: You can create an elastic database pool in minutes using the Microsoft Azure portal, PowerShell, or C#.

trans-unit.source: For details, see [Create and manage an elastic database pool](sql-database-elastic-pool-portal.md).
trans-unit.target: For details, see [Create and manage an elastic database pool](sql-database-elastic-pool-portal.md).

trans-unit.source: For detailed information about elastic database pools, including API and error details, see [Elastic database pool reference](sql-database-elastic-pool-reference.md).
trans-unit.target: For detailed information about elastic database pools, including API and error details, see [Elastic database pool reference](sql-database-elastic-pool-reference.md).

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Elastic database pools are currently in preview and only available with SQL Database V12 servers.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Elastic database pools are currently in preview and only available with SQL Database V12 servers.

trans-unit.source: Easily manage large numbers of databases with elastic database tools
trans-unit.target: Easily manage large numbers of databases with elastic database tools

trans-unit.source: In addition to providing more efficient resource utilization and predictable performance, elastic database pools make SaaS application development easier with tools that simplify building and managing your data-tier.
trans-unit.target: In addition to providing more efficient resource utilization and predictable performance, elastic database pools make SaaS application development easier with tools that simplify building and managing your data-tier.

trans-unit.source: Performing maintenance tasks and implementing changes across a large set of databases, a historically time-consuming and complex process, has been reduced to running scripts in elastic jobs.
trans-unit.target: Performing maintenance tasks and implementing changes across a large set of databases, a historically time-consuming and complex process, has been reduced to running scripts in elastic jobs.

trans-unit.source: The ability to create and run an elastic database job eliminates most all of the heavy lifting associated with administering hundreds or even thousands of databases.
trans-unit.target: The ability to create and run an elastic database job eliminates most all of the heavy lifting associated with administering hundreds or even thousands of databases.

trans-unit.source: For information about the elastic database jobs service that enables running Transact-SQL scripts across all elastic databases in a pool, see [Elastic database jobs overview](sql-database-elastic-jobs-overview.md).
trans-unit.target: For information about the elastic database jobs service that enables running Transact-SQL scripts across all elastic databases in a pool, see [Elastic database jobs overview](sql-database-elastic-jobs-overview.md).

trans-unit.source: A rich and powerful set of developer tools for implementing elastic database application patterns is also available.
trans-unit.target: A rich and powerful set of developer tools for implementing elastic database application patterns is also available.

trans-unit.source: For sharded databases, other tools such as the split-merge tool gives you the ability to split data from one shard and merge it into another.
trans-unit.target: For sharded databases, other tools such as the split-merge tool gives you the ability to split data from one shard and merge it into another.

trans-unit.source: This greatly reduces the work of managing large-scale sharded databases.
trans-unit.target: This greatly reduces the work of managing large-scale sharded databases.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the [Elastic database tools topics map](sql-database-elastic-scale-documentation-map.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see the [Elastic database tools topics map](sql-database-elastic-scale-documentation-map.md).

trans-unit.source: Business continuity features for databases in a pool
trans-unit.target: Business continuity features for databases in a pool

trans-unit.source: Currently in the preview, elastic databases support most [business continuity features](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/hh852669.aspx) that are available to single databases on V12 servers.
trans-unit.target: Currently in the preview, elastic databases support most [business continuity features](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/hh852669.aspx) that are available to single databases on V12 servers.

trans-unit.source: Backing up and restoring databases ([Point in Time Restore](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/hh852669.aspx#BKMK_PITR))
trans-unit.target: Backing up and restoring databases ([Point in Time Restore](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/hh852669.aspx#BKMK_PITR))

trans-unit.source: Databases in an elastic database pool are backed up automatically by the system and the backup retention policy is the same as the corresponding service tier for single databases.
trans-unit.target: Databases in an elastic database pool are backed up automatically by the system and the backup retention policy is the same as the corresponding service tier for single databases.

trans-unit.source: More specifically, an elastic database in a Basic pool can be restored to any restore point within the last 7 days, an elastic database in a Standard pool can be restored to any restore point within the last 14 days, and an elastic database in a Premium pool can be restored to any restore point within the last 35 days.
trans-unit.target: More specifically, an elastic database in a Basic pool can be restored to any restore point within the last 7 days, an elastic database in a Standard pool can be restored to any restore point within the last 14 days, and an elastic database in a Premium pool can be restored to any restore point within the last 35 days.

trans-unit.source: During preview, databases in a pool will be restored to a new database in the same pool.
trans-unit.target: During preview, databases in a pool will be restored to a new database in the same pool.

trans-unit.source: Dropped databases will always be restored as a standalone database outside the pool into the lowest performance level for that service tier.
trans-unit.target: Dropped databases will always be restored as a standalone database outside the pool into the lowest performance level for that service tier.

trans-unit.source: For example, an elastic database in a Standard pool that is dropped will be restored as an S0 database.
trans-unit.target: For example, an elastic database in a Standard pool that is dropped will be restored as an S0 database.

trans-unit.source: You can perform database restore operations through the Azure Portal or programmatically using REST API.
trans-unit.target: You can perform database restore operations through the Azure Portal or programmatically using REST API.

trans-unit.source: PowerShell cmdlet support is coming soon.
trans-unit.target: PowerShell cmdlet support is coming soon.

trans-unit.source: Geo-Restore
trans-unit.target: Geo-Restore

trans-unit.source: Geo-Restore allows you to recover a database in a pool to a server in a different region.
trans-unit.target: Geo-Restore allows you to recover a database in a pool to a server in a different region.

trans-unit.source: During the preview, to restore a database in a pool on a different server, the target server needs to have a pool with the same name as the source pool.
trans-unit.target: During the preview, to restore a database in a pool on a different server, the target server needs to have a pool with the same name as the source pool.

trans-unit.source: If needed, create a new pool on the target server and give it the same name prior to restoring the database.
trans-unit.target: If needed, create a new pool on the target server and give it the same name prior to restoring the database.

trans-unit.source: If a pool with the same name on the target server doesn’t exist the Geo-Restore operation will fail.
trans-unit.target: If a pool with the same name on the target server doesn’t exist the Geo-Restore operation will fail.

trans-unit.source: You can perform Geo-Restore operations using the Azure Portal or REST API.
trans-unit.target: You can perform Geo-Restore operations using the Azure Portal or REST API.

trans-unit.source: PowerShell cmdlet support is coming soon.
trans-unit.target: PowerShell cmdlet support is coming soon.

trans-unit.source: Geo-Replication
trans-unit.target: Geo-Replication

trans-unit.source: Databases that already have Geo-Replication enabled can be moved in and out of an elastic database pool and replication will continue to work as always.
trans-unit.target: Databases that already have Geo-Replication enabled can be moved in and out of an elastic database pool and replication will continue to work as always.

trans-unit.source: You can enable Geo-Replication on a database that is already in a pool if the target server you specify has a pool with the same name as the source pool.
trans-unit.target: You can enable Geo-Replication on a database that is already in a pool if the target server you specify has a pool with the same name as the source pool.

trans-unit.source: Import and Export
trans-unit.target: Import and Export

trans-unit.source: Export of a database from within a pool is supported.
trans-unit.target: Export of a database from within a pool is supported.

trans-unit.source: Currently, import of a database directly into a pool is not supported, but you can import into a single database and then move the database into a pool.
trans-unit.target: Currently, import of a database directly into a pool is not supported, but you can import into a single database and then move the database into a pool.
